website_summaries.verdict: The Sensi Touch is a solid smart thermostat, but consider the Ecobee3 Lite or the Nest E if you're looking for similar features and a sleeker look.
pros: Emerson's $169 Sensi Touch Wi-Fi Thermostat works with Alexa, Google Assistant and Siri (via Apple HomeKit)
Its touchscreen interface is responsive and easy to use
cons: While its touchscreen works well and the design is an improvement over the older Sensi smart thermostat, it still looks a little outdated

customer_reviews.title: Company Does NOT back its product
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for a year. Then it stopped. It is warrantied for 5 years. When I called for a replacement, they gave me an endless run-around. I needed to do this, that, and another thing, including paying a technician to check A/C unit and voltage. All done at $200+ expense. Then I needed an "extender" that boosted my Wi-Fi (even after I explained that the Wi-Fi and the thermostat had worked well for a year). I would never recommend this company or this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Both hardware & software have bugs
customer_reviews.text: I installed many thermostats before. This one was easy to install. But, the app has bugs. I set up schedule on the app when I installed it. It disappeared 2nd day. I rebooted by turning off furnace power & it show the error message “Therstate is not working properly, ....” on the screen & no longer worked. There is no way a thermostat die after a few power on and off. What happens if there is power outage? App only works for one day. This product is not ready for prime time. I return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Defective?
customer_reviews.text: Its been 2 months and we’re not happy. it keeps cycling off/on. my husband wants to trash it and buy a nest. i want to see if there a fix but my hopes arent high. Update. Sensi has contacted us consurning the review. The day I posted this we hooked up the Nest and threw away the Sensi. FYI- the sensi is not reusable. All the little switches snapped off when I gently tried to pull them up. Total one time use. I’ve had others which we could reuse
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not suited to dual transformer systems + poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my home where I have a heating system controlled by Taco zone valves and a separate AC system. The resulting systems are independent of each other, The A/C is off over the MA winter. I have a separate C wire to provide power to the thermostat. However, they thermostat doesn't work when connected to both heat and AC. I contacted Emerson and they suggested I contact the thermostat manufacturer for support and/or get an electrician. Very disappointed and since I'm past the 30-day window, I now have an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Do not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my original post. The Sensi no longer works with Alexa. Is always off line. There are other good thermostats out there that stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product but heat pump users ready this!
customer_reviews.text: So the product itself it awesome! Does the job I wanted it to do. The problem with it is if you have a heat pump, some of the newer thermostats have a built in O/B terminal but still looks like it’s plugged into the W slot. I did not realize this and spent hours trying to get the heater and air conditioner to work correctly. You have to take out the W and put it into the O/B on the new device and you’ll be off to th races. None of their tutorials cover this possibility.
customer_reviews.author: James Bynum

customer_reviews.title: didn't work, couldn't get customer service
customer_reviews.text: I installed it as directed and the display never came on. I traced all the wiring and still no success. I called technical help and was on hold for 48 minutes when I finally opted to use the call back option on the prompt. two hours later I still did not get a call back. I reinstalled the old thermostat to get heat back in the house. FYI I have a reasonable amount of experience with maintenance of heating systems as well as low voltage electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just wow.!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok first off, I must say i almost returned this item thinking it wasn't compatible with my home. well turns out it is a C wire comes with all homes just have to look for it. I installed it and never knew that my C wire wasn't connected to my Ac unit. well i called customer service, just amazing service guys knew how to guide me step by step . don't get frustrated if you can't connect it just call customer service they will help you and you will have a successful connection. really great product and well build. 5 stars for me thank you sense support.
customer_reviews.author: guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Sensi will not connect to WiFi remotely
customer_reviews.text: We are out of town and our WiFi at home went out for 15 minutes and came back on. Sensi will not reconnect remotely with someone at the actual thermostat in the house. Now I can’t check the temperature or change anything on my phone app. Probably going to return it when I get home. Plus the customer service number is useless as no one answers and I said to call me back and nobody did.
customer_reviews.author: Janita Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Wireless compatibility modes are non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 2.4ghz Wireless a/b/g/n (most people probably have n at this point as minumum) this SHOULD work for you. However I have turned off all 2.4ghz in my home and use wireless AC 5ghz compatibility mode for my entire four router home. This should work according to Emersons documentation, however it doesn't. Some competitor thermostats do support AC/5ghz/compatibility so I am going with them. Screen looked pretty low resolution but the software was responsive and even showed humidity which some smart thermostats lack. If it actually supported AC/5ghz/Ncompat this might have been a decent buy. Waste of time even though I did plenty of research.
customer_reviews.author: DanKristen

customer_reviews.title: get the non-touch screen version instead
customer_reviews.text: I have had both - the older with buttons and now this new one for couple of month. I'd rather save the money and get the older version. It is just easier and quicker to use with those buttons. Additionally, the B&W screen was fantastic. The color touch screen in this model is of very poor quality. You can read it only looking directly at the screen. Touch controls are only available if you first touch the screen to wake it. The older version is cheaper, easier to use, very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of two hours.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of 2 hours. Following the instructions verbatim from the app, the panel never powered on. I watched the videos and thought I would uninstall it and then reinstall it -- maybe correcting a mistake I made. However, that wasn't the case. The panel still never turned on. It used the same configuration as my previous one which I had to reinstall. It is an incredible waste of time. I called tech support and they were closed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Honest

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, modern and effective.
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat is minimalist, modern and does it’s job. The backlighting on the wall, which is selective, adds a nice modern feel to the hallway. The only change I would make and hopefully the programmers are working on it, would be a timer for Filter usage. That seems like a relatively easy modification to make in the software, when the next release for the software is sent out to the units.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Ploung

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Simple yet functional. Doesn't have all the fancy bells and whistles of other brands but it does seem to be a very solid product. UPDATE... Only 4 months after purchase, the Sensi Thermostat has failed. After calling Customer Service and being put on hold for 2 HOURS, they said that they would send out a new thermostat ASAP and I should have it in 2 to 3 days... Now a week later, I called again (only a 15 min hold this time) they said it just shipped out today but that they have no idea as to when I will get it. UNRELIABLE thermostat and even WORSE Customer Service..
customer_reviews.author: ADodge

customer_reviews.title: No 'Hold' function
customer_reviews.text: The install app was great, the quality of the unit is very good. I have three complaints though: 1. It should have a simple 'hold' function where you can lock it at temp. It doesnt have this. 2. The scheduling function is not that intuitive. I tried to add more schedules (like "vacation" and it was strange, i could edit 6 days but not 7 days of the week...) 3. the picture makes it look like the screen can be orange or blue. It's not. the screen is grey. It's only blue when in cooling is on and only orange when the furnace is actually on.
customer_reviews.author: Genny

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the mone
customer_reviews.text: I have tried some of the other wifi thermostats, this one is worth the money. Please read all the directions, i didn't & found out my unit was running on heat strips. My a/c company doing a p&m show me what i didn't do. Thankfully it was only running on heat strips about 2 or 3 weeks, and we only had a few cold days. This thermostat shows how long unit has run every day. Pretty neat & wifi works great. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Love it - can change temp with Alexa or from the app
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was always sitting on the couch or in my office feeling hot or cold and didn't want to get up to change the thermostat. Or sometimes I would be watching TV and the AC would kick on and it runs loudly, so I wanted the ability to turn it off. This new thermostat allows you to control the AC and heat by asking Alexa ("Alexa, turn up the thermostat by 1 degree") or on your phone app, so I'm thrilled about the inexpensive way to accomplish my goals!
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device to manage temperature
customer_reviews.text: This device has been great to manage a thermostat realtime instead of through schedules as those change. This device has been great to change settings and make sure somebody did not leave the heat or AC set incorrectly. Looking to add to a lake cottage to manage when we are not there. Save a trip to confirm you turned the AC back up when you left. Covers the same foot print as my old thermostat so not touch ups were needed. Highly recommend. It did require an extra wire for the "C" terminal as my original set up did not have an extra one unused. No big deal if you ever worked with wiring and the access was not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: tkgibson

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again. There are many better options.
customer_reviews.text: Needs a HOLD and RUN/RESUME option like many (most?) other thermostats. With this useful option, the temp stays the same after pressing HOLD until you select RUN, at which time the programmed schedule resumes. Simple and effective. But on this over engineered thermostat, there isn't a simple HOLD option. Instead the only way to HOLD the temp indefinitely is to completely turn off the programmed scheduling. If you change the temp when scheduling is on, it only stays at that temp for a couple of hours and then automatically resumes the schedule. WTH? Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: WMJ

customer_reviews.title: Still not working
customer_reviews.text: The installation manual requires internet access. Installation requires that power be turned off. Turning off the power disconnects the internet. Someone didn't think this one through. Strike One When I describe my current installation to the app it says that it's invalid and refuses to continue. But the old thermostat works just fine. Strike Two When I call tech support they say that they're busy and will call back. Five hours of no AC during a heat-wave in southern Arizona and no call-back. Strike Three. The one positive thing: It all fits into the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: GaryH

customer_reviews.title: Oh that it could all be so simple...
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup - instructions are clear and as long as you follow them and comprehend what your are being directed to do you will be fine. Not a big fan of a "smart" home but nothing beats being able to adjust the thermostat from my iPhone. Sensi software is what's required and it's straightforward. Haven't done much advanced programming but haven't felt the need to because control as always within arms' reach. Cheaper on Amazon than big box home supply stores. Plus got a rebate from power co. - check yours.
customer_reviews.author: DrTeeth

customer_reviews.title: About 5 minutes away from sending this thing back!
customer_reviews.text: Update: we finally got the app to work and connect with the Thermostat, and it only took half a day. We didn't change anything, just kept trying until it finally connected. So far so good... Installation went fairly smooth, until the app got to the part where you register the Thermostat. It would not take the information no matter what. Now the app won't see it and the only way to control it is the front panel. Also will not be seen by Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use Wifi Theromostat!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the Sensi Touch Wi-Fi Thermostat. It was super easy to install. In their app, you select which wires you see, they give labels to label them for after you unplug them and make it really easy to connect to the Sensi base. The app tells you if the wires you have will work with the new thermostat, etc The base even has a backlight to help you wire up in the dark when you turn the power off. :) It even has a Geofencing feature! If you're nearing home, it'll automatically turn on the heat/AC so it's comfortable when you arrive! How cool is that?!
customer_reviews.author: B. Liebowitz

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I LOVE this thermostat! We got a refurbished one for about $85 (much cheaper than the other smart thermostats and was in mint condition.) It’s especially great for when we’re on the road working. We live in Florida so it’s great to be able to keep an eye on the humidity level in the house (too high will allow mold to grow) and to be able to cool the house off on our way home. The app is very convenient and works well. Great for even changing the temp while laying in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat with a Couple Bugs
customer_reviews.text: After considerable research I decided on these. Bought two for two zone home Application. They work quite well with two exceptions. The units sometimes lose connection to my WIFI, precluding the ability to control them remotely with my iPhone. This may be a bug in the application. Turning my phone off and on usually reconnects. Also the geofencing beta feature just doesn’t work. It will get stuck on home even though I’m away (more than 3 miles) or get stuck on away when I arrive home.
customer_reviews.author: starbucksfreak

customer_reviews.title: bringing the house to a smart house
customer_reviews.text: I installed the thermostat in less than 2 hours, Because being a older home and many remodels, felt it would be a good time to upgrade the wiring to the furnace. This even made it easier to hook up, the app waled me through exactly how to install the wires. Love having the blower being able to circulate the air. One draw back, and I hope it will be coming, but the ability to wire the whole house humidifier into the unit. This unit qualified for energy star, so we will be getting $75.00 back, can you say no brainier.
customer_reviews.author: t campbell

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction Easy To Install
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 5 stars except for the following: 1. The backlight color of the display cannot be changed. No big deal. 2. The App will not allow access to thermostats registered by to other users without logout from one account and login to another. My wife owned a condo with two of these when we married. I had a house with two of these. We cannot give access to each others thermostats without deleting one account and adding the deleted thermostats to the other's account. Again, no big deal. The good part is that the connector tabs are much stronger than the two competitors devices that both arrived with broken wire connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Noeule

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for old thermostats!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I replaced two thermostats in my house that were around 17 years old and these were perfect. Wifi works well, nice looking on the wall. Piece of cake to walk through the provided steps and the app is great also for install. No need for a professional install..just need a screwdriver basically. I have this integrated with Alexa to change tempuratures. I definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: LJH

customer_reviews.title: Great! Really love it.  But shouldn’t need Apple key chain.
customer_reviews.text: The set up was extremely easy and the app is very useful and informative. The thermostat itself is great. What I hate, tho is it requires you to use Apple keychain - which I do not want to use. It also requires Apple home services be on. Not sure why they would make these unnecessary things mandatory. Very frustrating. Overall it’s good, and works with WiFi. Update - raising this to 4 stars. I really like the system and i don’t think other popular name brands are worth the extra cost. Seems to get better with every update as well. 4.5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Decent Thermostat but a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The installation was easy and connection with Alexa was no problem. I was disappointed that you don't have full Alexa voice control of all thermostat features (can't change back-lighting or turn fan to "on"). Also, I have a heat pump and rather than having the Aux Heat come on when needed, it's got a separate Aux Heat mode, and it's not clear how this works. Minor things: a little smaller than I expected, resolution is poor (you can see the pixels), and the orange background color is ugly.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Love at first site
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit! This is my second Sensi unit. The first was the button one and we loved every feature and the app! We then moved and Instantly missed the control we had over our house! So we started looking for another one and found they made a sleek touch screen. Love at first sight. Easy to install and love the look in our house. I did have to call tech support and they were able to help me quickly and easily. I feel this unit is on the top on the market over other wifi units. Very easy to use and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of the Sensi-Touch thermostats to replace Spectrum/Time Warner thermostats (Spectrum discontinued their Intelligent Home division leaving customer high and dry and stuck with their worthless equipment). The Sensi-Touch thermostats are actually a great improvement over the old Wifi technology. The read out is bold and easy to adjust (though I do wish the screen would stay on continuously ... it shuts off after a minute or so and goes dark, coming back to life only after you touch it). It is VERY responsive from the phone app which is what we use most of the time, and the few times we have used it with Alexa it has performed well. Overall, very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: OMG, read the privacy policy before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Please read the privacy policy. They collect EVERYTHING including personal information. And share it with ANYONE they feel like it. Search for it with “Sensi Emerson privacy policy” They don’t even pretend to care about privacy. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: SkepticByNature

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and it will save you money
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to have trouble putting this thing together but it actually was very easy!! It only took me roughly 20 minutes for installation and setup. This thing works very well especially when I'm on the go and I love it. it is definitely going to be saving me money in the long run... UPDATE AS OF 9/27/19 Since I've purchased this product I have saved ALOT of money in heating and cooling costs. The app allows you to control it while away from home, set a schedule and at what settings your comfortable with, and shows how much energy was used in a monthly basis. A MUST FOR A SMART HOME 👍
customer_reviews.author: djshorti

customer_reviews.title: On hold for 1 hour with no help.
customer_reviews.text: After following the directions we still had an issue with the system once it was all hooked up (it was flashing like a strobe). The real problem was when I tried calling. I waited for an hour on hold and there was no indication of my place in "line" or something to tell if I just needed to hang up and try calling again. Also it's worth noting that this issue was one that, when found online, the answer was to call customer service. Still have 2 stars because the instructions were pretty clear and the products looked and felt nice, but oof that phone call.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey LaVoie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat was pretty easy to wire and set up. It looks nice and is straightforward to operate. After working well for about 24 hours it stopped being able to shut off my indoor fan once the call for heat stopped. Changing the temp didn't work. Turning off the thermostat entirely didn't work either. I had to turn power off at the breaker to stop the fan. I reinstalled my old thermostat and it worked fine. Returned the Sensi.
customer_reviews.author: texmln

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi thermostat without the high price tag
customer_reviews.text: This device works great. I used to have in my previous house a NEST thermostat and recently moved and wanted something similar to the Nest thermostat without the price tag. This one had great reviews about how it worked and it also looks very nice. The settings are basically the same as to what the nest thermostat had so I lost no functionality with Sensi. I had to to contact customer service twice; first during installation and later for the nice backlight it has which was not turning on. On both occasions they responded quickly and the problems were solved quickly. I am very happy with this thermostat and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Keeps blowing my fuses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought Sept. 13, installed it on the 15th, and it immediately took out a fuse and stopped working. Worked an hour with tech support, and then had to call an AC tech - $200. I woke up this morning, only 2-1/2 months after correcting problems, and it's dead. Tech support (24/7) was too busy to get back to me. Thankfully, I have a space heater, because I don't want another emergency weekend bill. Maybe I can return it. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: D. Archer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: My power went out about 6 months ago during a really bad storm here in Atlanta, so the wifi went out too which made the thermostat disconnect. Ever since then, I've been trying to get it off of my wall to reset it and I can't, so it has the wrong date and time, and it also made it stop working with the app, extremely frustrating because that was one of the reasons I actually purchased it, not only that, I don't feel like it accurately reads the temperature in the house. I definitely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: I spend too much money with amazon!

customer_reviews.title: No battery back up
customer_reviews.text: This product works well at maintaining the temperature. I like the display. Easy to use and adjust schedules, times, dates, temps etc. But there is no battery back up. We loose power pretty often. I wake up in the middle of the night suffocating and freezing during the day.. ooops. Lost power need to reset the thermostat. Tired of that. $136 down the drain. This sucks. My 20 year old thermostat even had a battery back up. My fault I didn’t read it and didn’t question it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade to work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thermostat to upgrade from a very old model with no features. I wanted one that would integrate with Alexa and that could be adjusted remotely. Installation was a breeze, first thing is to download app and follow the very clear instructions. I did not have the C wire run to my thermostat, but the video instructions gave me clear direction on how to hook the new wire. Once hooked up the power was turned back on, and presto it was on and ready to sync up with wifi. I have never had anything sync with wifi and alexa with such ease! very impressed
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: Just as other reviews I rad, the customer service is almost non existent! If you can install without help (at all) them this may be a good choice. After an hour and half on hold they asked if I had a Volt meter which I did. I was getting 23.7 V and was told that was my issue. No so much. This is a standard for any 24v system. Whether you need customer service or not, it would be nice if they could at least answer the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Misik

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: The only way this thing is getting bad reviews is from someone installing it incorrectly. This thing is great, works perfectly, the interface is basic and straightforward. The app is very easy to navigate and works instantensouly, meaning as soon as I make a change on the app, it immediately reacts at the thermostat, there is no delay. Couldn't be happier with this. NOTE: MAKE SURE YOU TURN OFF YOUR CIRCUIT BREAKER, I SKIPPED THIS STEP BECAUSE I KNEW TO BE CAREFUL WITH WIRES, BUT IT BLEW THE 5AMP FUSE INSIDE MY AC UNIT AND HAD TO GO BUY A NEW ONE. Granted it was only $2-3 at the local store and less than 5 minutes to change, but still.
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: You do not have to use Apple HomeKit. You can just use the Sensi Application. Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: EASY installation. I recommend setting up to work with the Sensi application via WiFi - call Sensi tech support to bypass Apple HomeKit. You can easily use HomeKit, but I prefer to use the Sensi App. For controlling my thermostats from remote. Super easy to program via the Sensi app. I love the geofencing feature so far. The thermostat looks fantastic. Works flawlessly so far. Make sure you have a SMALL flat head screwdriver to unscrew your old wires from your thermostat. You do not need a screwdriver to attach wires to the Sensi Touch thermometer. Total time to install is about 20 minutes and I have zero experience with electrical or HVAC equipment installation.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hubbell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: - Deffective out of the box - Customer Service does not answer (waited almost 2 hours) - Customer Service does not return calls (requested call back after waiting for 2 hours) Do not waste your time or money. Read the other negative reviews and you will see I am not the first. Ended up buying a Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Fiend

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, doesn't work well, VERY difficult to hook up WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this thing is ridiculous. First, it's NOT what they claim it is, it's virtually impossible to get the thing to hook up to wifi, as you must download an APPLE Home app, which DOES NOT work well at all. I've owned both a Nest, and and HP, which were simple and intuitive, AND they worked! I only bought this because of the ratings, but will be return it, it is junk. It doesn't even allow you to connect to wifi, without downloading the HomeKit app, total crap product.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The wiring on my existing heat pump thermostat was rather confusing, so I wasn't sure exactly how to wire this product. They have very good instructions with the app, but of course they can't cover all circumstances. So, I contacted Sensi support and they gave me step by step wiring instructions. I wired it up and it works great. Also, of all my wifi gadgets this had the easiest setup. It connected right away and the app works great. So, I ordered another Sensi thermostat for my upstairs unit. I do not use Alexa so I cannot comment on this feature. Other than that this product is everything it claims to be. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron E

customer_reviews.title: Unit works fine, customer support is garbage....
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the initial setup, so I put in a ticket with customer support. I ended up doing some searching on the internet and figured out my issue and got it running. Works fine, does what it's supposed to. I knocked 2 stars as customer support finally got back to me today, 3 weeks after submitting my ticket... with the excuse that they have been overwhelmed with calls and emails. Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Connects to my Wi-Fi then within minutes disconnects from it. Tried several times - the same result
customer_reviews.text: It connects to the Wi-fi network then within minutes gets kicked and you have to start all over again. I had a professional NVAC/electrician installing and trying to setup network for hours. Then tried myself. No luck. Gets connected and disconnected again within minutes. At least it shows the temperature that I hope is correct. The old thermometer showed 70 degrees, this one displays 76. Go figure. It sure doesn’t feel like 76 degrees inside when the outside temperature is 40. If this installation is “easy”, then I don’t know what “hard” or “impossible” would be... Disappointed. Wasted $$$.
customer_reviews.author: ErikT

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if I could. We hooked it up and it took at least a couple hours. In the middle of the night the whole thermostat went blank, it worked fine during the day and then it just stopped working. It has no batteries so it wasn’t a battery life issue. We had to put our old thermostat on to control our heating and air and now that one won’t work either. So this thermostat did something to our entire system that made it not work. We have to call out an HVAC person to come check it out now. Don’t buy this thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Modern Tech for an Ancient Furnace
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a twenty five year old Honeywell Programmable Thermostat controlling an equally old Lennox 21 Pulse. Took me no more than thirty minutes and that included discarding / sorting out the wiring that use to control a central HVAC and heat pump arrangement. The only thing that caught me off was having to switch my phone over to a 2.4g access point, the SenSi doesn't support 5g, this is similar to many of the home "smart" appliances. Other than that, it was just follow along with the prompts in the app. Love the fact I have remote access to the furnace now
customer_reviews.author: UnregisteredTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Cycles my AC too often
customer_reviews.text: I like the thermostat and the app. The problem with it is tries to control the temperature to less than 1 degree Fahrenheit. My AC runs for about 5 minutes every 15- way too often. There is an adjustment for it in the app- fast , medium and slow, but tech support told me even of slow it controls the temperature something like .75 Farenheit! The thermostat doesn't even show a temperature change during cooling cycles. I'd love to return it, but cooling season started after the return date ended.
customer_reviews.author: Jane K. Kearsing

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: Installed following the video installation guide. Had to use the ground for the C wire as instructed with the jumper wire. It worked for 2 weeks and then stopped working during a 95 + degree day. I figured it was something with the A/C system and then found out $225 dollars later that you cannot use the ground wire to replace the C wire. After an A/C check out another wire was needed to be run for the C wire also the ground wire replaced in the original spot. An expensive lesson , don't believe everything you see..Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bum

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and awesome features, great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thermostat. Took a little but to install because it replaced a standard non programmable thermo, so I Had to run a common "C" line. During that process, even after killing all the power, I arc'd the ground and burnt the fuse in the control panel. Took me a day in the Texas summer to find the issue, so I was anxious to get it done. Once I found the fuse, was easy to get up and running. The programming, wifi and especially geofencing are excellent features ad are easy to use. App and instructions are direct and pretty easy. Rate it an intermediate level install since you are dealing with electricity, so take all precautions needed.
customer_reviews.author: LEWS THERIN

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and support
customer_reviews.text: Installed fairly easy and ran out to run errands for an hour had set to 67 degrees on cool. I checked to make sure it was working properly and it was so I headed out. Came home and the heat was on full blast and it was 80 degrees inside the house...91 outside! Currently on the line with support 45 minutes and have yet to speak to someone. What good is 24 hr support if it takes an hour to reach someone? Your typical run around...
customer_reviews.author: Andy Fenn

customer_reviews.title: Three weeks to respond after receiving Tech Support Number
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat display did not function upon installation. There was a C wire and had passed Emerson’s website test indicating that my wiring configuration should work. After 65 minutes on hold for Tech Support I completed their on line form requesting help. Next day, December 16, I received a Tech Support case number. After no response I used the same form 4 days later to further ask assistance. After a further week of not receiving any communication I returned the item. On January 8 I received a reply. That is 15 working days, 3 full weeks, for Emerson to address my request for help. And that’s excluding holidays. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Kay B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this thermostat! We don’t have Alexa or google home or anything like that. We simply wanted a wifi integrated thermostat that we could control when we’re away from home (or being lazy and not wanting to get up). This unit looks nice and is super easy to control. As far as installation goes, my father in law came over and had it installed relatively fast and easily. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: acowger

customer_reviews.title: Easy as pie
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze, the app walks you right through every step. Setting schedules isn't the most intuitive thing I've ever seen but it isn't difficult. I wish the backlight could be put on a schedule, I just ended up turning it off. It's amazing how much of a difference a single degree can make, especially if you make the change before you're miserable. My electricity bill last month was lower than the same month last year, despite higher temperatures. I'm convinced this is making a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Brianne

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy if Customer Support Is Important To You
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much like this thermostat except for a fatal flaw for which I cannot raise customer support. In the event of a power outage and subsequent power on, there is a long delay for the thermostat room temperature to rise to the actual (as measure by other thermometers nearby) room temp. Consequently the furnace will come on full strength and overshoot the thermostat set temperature by 3 or 4 degrees in its attempt to reach the thermostat room temp. I am going to replace this Sensi with something else very soon!
customer_reviews.author: Stewbum

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Could Keep It
customer_reviews.text: I think I would have given this 5 stars but we never got it installed because you need a C wire. There are 3 other options to connect but they consist of accessing your furnace...ours is in the attic. If you can rewire your furnace then that is an option but for older homes this may not be the smart thermostat for you unless you want to hire an electrician, which is another option.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki M

customer_reviews.title: Simple but limited
customer_reviews.text: Setup was pretty simple with no issues. App for thermostat is simple and intuitive. If you’re seeking a remotely programmable thermostats, it does that job well, but it isn’t smart (it doesn’t learn your habits or anything). We couldn’t easily access our thermostat because of where it was on the wall, so it’s nice to be able to use our phone, but it only allows temperature settings, even though it measures and displays humidity. It is the only thermostat in our house so I can’t speak to pairing and temp control in a multi unit situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel D Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Good smart thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the setup program for this thermostat. It made the setup very easy until it would not work for heat. During setup it gives you the option of gas, electric or boiler for heat, I have a heat pump. After the heat would not work I started searching the web and found that there is another setting buried in the advanced settings to setup for heat pump. Once I set that it started working. Why not put heat pump as an option when setting it up to avoid this issue. Beyond that, it works as expected and looks very nice on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sehr

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly, I really like that. My old programmable thermostat was a night mare to program. My HVAC guy did have to do some creative wiring on my furnace to be able to hook it up to the Sensi, but it’s a 19 year old furnace. I believe that if I had a newer furnace model, that I could easily have installed the Sensi myself. I would most certainly recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Corrals

customer_reviews.title: Delicate Electronics...Buy New
customer_reviews.text: I thought a wearhouse deal for this product would be cool because of the price. This is not a clunky piece of electronics, it's sensitive. Buy new! This one did not work, but the new one is working like a charm! LOVE IT!!! When you are hot at night (or Cold) you don't have to get up to adjust your thermostat, just use your phone or Alexa. Paired easily and the app is very simple. If this one had worked, I'd have given it 5 stars (and yes, I looked at videos, called Tech support and even had someone who put it in his house come over and try to install it)
customer_reviews.author: Audible 1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Set Up. Great App
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WiFi thermostat to remotely control the temperature for my senior mother that lives hours away. I found installation was a breeze, the display looks great and is easy to read. I love that you can set a temperature range that will activate the heater if temp goes below your low set point or the A/C if temp goes above the high set point. If she tells me she finds the temp to hot or cold, I can instantly change it remotely. Just a well made product with easy to use phone app.
customer_reviews.author: CU

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: The Good: If you are looking for a simplistic smart home A/C thermostat this is a very good choice. Integrates with your smartphone which can simplify configuration and setup. The setup is straightforward which took me about 15 minutes start to finish. The Not So Good: Similar to most "smart devices" the sensi APP collects your personal information in various ways. If using the Sensi App it asks for your home address and name. I had some issues connecting to this device via the app and had to try 4 different times before I was successful. * Your home A/C will need a C wire for this device to work.
customer_reviews.author: dmbTank

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Easy to install and configure.
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and setup. Connected to my wifi with no problems. Wife was able to get it on her phone easily after I got it set up on mine. Simple and easy to use. Great interface and scheduler. I'll admit to being biased - my last "smart" thermostat was a piece of crap with a horrible app and was a complete PITA to get onto the wifi (it spent the last 12 months of it's life offline).
customer_reviews.author: GreenEgg

customer_reviews.title: One issue
customer_reviews.text: Good value priced and easy installation but, the temperature sensor on this thermostat is very sensitive and erratic. I adusted on this thing for 3 days and could not get it to function correctly. The problem is the temperature would warm up too fast ( on the thermometer of the thermostat ), the AC would come on and then very quickly within 5 minutes the temperature reading would come down causing the AC to shut off. I place 3 other thermostats close by to check, they all matched each other but not the thermostat one. Contacted customer support but did not receive a reply. My unit cycled on and off way too often.
customer_reviews.author: C. Duke

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to get a smart thermostat but hate the way the Nest looks as well as its price. Our electric company gave us a $75 rebate when we installed this so it was darn near free. Our home was built in 2003 and so we did not have the required c wire so we had to purchase one of those add-on kits. That part was actually a pain in the butt, as it was not clear exactly how to do it since every installer does things a little differently. But once that was in place the Sensi's install was super super simple through the iPhone app. We love being able to control the temp from our phone or Alexa!
customer_reviews.author: J1976

customer_reviews.title: Very nice technology - two units both needed calls to support - be prepared to WAIT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units - I love how easy it was to install each of them - I needed help from support to connect the device to my WiFi and I needed help installing one unit to our "Heat Pump" - it isn't gas or electric or.... So I called and waited, and waited, ...however once the phone call was answered we finished successfully - don't expect anything product to install flawlessly, especially when networking is involved. The installation process is weak and incomplete - why, because it isn't easy. Good luck, I'd do it again, I like these units after one month of service.
customer_reviews.author: OUT2SEE

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and works well via mobile and Wi-Fi and Alexa. 2 Considerations I had not made: 1) PUD offers a $75 rebate for Nest, Ecobee, Bryant and Carrier Smart thermostats. Sensi is not on that list. I guess it has to be able to ”Automatically monitor and reduce power needs when the house is empty". 2) Biweekly - It would be nice to have a biweekly schedule. I am off every other Friday and always jump up (or mobile) to turn the heat off as programmed to come on when I am at the office on Fridays. Don’t know if the others have this but would be valuable for me...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I received the unit and when I went to replace my old thermostat the wiring did not match any of the settings in the installation manual. I called tech support and they were great. They came up with the wiring configuration I required. Everything works great. The reason for the four stars is because I purchased the smart thermostat so I could turn my smart ceiling fans on and off with the HVAC system. Turns out there is no on/off status passed by the thermostat to allow creation of a routine. I mentioned this to tech support and they just said to send in an e-mail with the request.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Day

customer_reviews.title: WORKS PERFECTLY, LOVE REMOTE ACCESS - GREAT FOR RENTAL HOMES
customer_reviews.text: Installed in our vacation rental so that we can monitor, adjust temp remotely as needed. I had to run a new 5-wire from furnace to stat because we only had a 2-wire. Easy-to-follow instructions and set-up with phone was a breeze. I'm 56 and didn't even need my husband's help, so clearly anyone can install this! :-) Highly recommend, so glad we went with this brand. I like the shape and look of the thermostat, as well as the blue color when cooling and orange color when heating. Also like the clean look of the numbers and not a lot of unnecessary information on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: michelle b

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat has cut my electricity bill in half without any of my own thought besides setup. I have it set to basically turn off my AC / Heat when I am not home and it starts back up shortly before my routines so I never even notice. Get yourself an Alexa, some smart dimmers, and this Sensi smart thermostat. Only con is that I wish it had more Alexa functionality besides setting temperature and getting information
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck fully integrating with Alexa Show 2
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would easily integrate with the Alexa Show2...well it will with an additional hub. It also does not easily replace a common multifunction thermostat without spending a lot of time waiting for tech support and jury rigging wires...the tech was great and honest that the unit would not fully integrate without the additional hub as I couldn’t obtain the necessary code for a required addition app.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat.  Phone (iPhone XMax) App and Alexa are flawless.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this vs. Nest to save a bunch of money vs. Nest. Easy to install. I had to install a C wire transformer since my system did not have one. Works great! The app is flawless along with excellent Alexa control. Alexa has not misunderstood a command yet. Has a integrated LED light over the wiring terminals to help you see during install. Great options for screen lighting off, on, dim and off in timer. Also has a back lighting for the rear of the unit. White led only. Pic below. If you can live without the Nest name and want to save some money this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: KawiZX14

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use with touch screen and remotely via Google Home
customer_reviews.text: My original home's central air conditioner and natural gas furnace (heater) thermostat did not have a "C" wire attached, but there was an unused wire in the existing harness that connects to the AC/Heater unit's PC board (where the other thermostat wires are connected). I connected the unused wire to the "C" port on the PC board and also to the new Sen Si thermostat. I use Google Home to control other third party devices for lights and appliances. I was very glad to see Sen Si was an option in Google Home. Once I authorized Google Home to access my Sen Si account, I was able to change the temperature settings accordingly via Google Home.
customer_reviews.author: Chapin

customer_reviews.title: After A Lot Of Work - DOA
customer_reviews.text: Installed a few days ago. Went to the troulbe of running a new C wire. Double checked all the connectiions, nothing. Then checked all the voltages, still nothing. Called my HVAC guy and checked everything again. Nothing. Called Emerson today and they're sending me a new one. Hope it works. Just got the replacement, still doesn't work despite help from my HVAC professional. Must be a compatability issue with the newer Trane furnaces. Back to my old Emerson stat which still works fine. Was hoping for some of the newer features, guess not.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Unit
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find anyone to install or knew how to install this thermostat at a reasonable price (over $200). I finally found a technician and the thermostat is completely dead! I downloaded the app per instructions he had it all hooked up correctly with the common wire and it will not turn on. Called customer service and was in hold over 30 minutes so I'm hoping I could reach someone because it's past the return window and this was not a cheap unit.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: One flaw
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona and do super-cooling. This product will automatically shut it's self off every two hours if it hasn't hit the target cooling temp. There is no way to override this feature. If known, I would have made a different purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake J.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t get it set up
customer_reviews.text: Can’t really review the item because I couldn’t get it to work. In order to use the WiFi feature with your iPhone you have to turn on “keychain” in your iCloud, not sure why. In order to have keychain turned on you have to have 2 factor authentication turned on which means you have to enter a passcode or use facial recognition. I don’t use either. I turned on keychain and it still wouldn’t work. I kept getting a message on the app that said turn keychain on.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and setup. The temperature reading is a little off (+/- 2), and the humidity reading is way off (+/- 25%). However, there are settings within the Sensi app for the temperature and humidity offset. It integrates with Amazon and Apple products without any issues. Overall, I love this thermostat. Installation note: if you don’t currently have a C wire (common wire), it was really easy to connect one between the furnace and thermostat. The Sensi website has some helpful instructions and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy a used one. Just buy it new.
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new thermostat. I bought 2 one for upstairs and one for downstairs. They are pretty easy to wire and the app helps. (Like super super easy to install). The reason I give it 4 stars is that I had to order a replacement because all the prongs were bent and the thermostat wouldn't work. Second one same problem. They just weren't so bad and I could fix it. Just buy the new one. I have a feeling people bend the prongs not installing it right. then return it for not working. Who ever checks them isn't doing a very good job considering I got 2 with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Kisil

customer_reviews.title: wifi thermostat
customer_reviews.text: we had this product installed for a year and almost two months. It broke one day. there was no power to the thermostat. I had to replace it immediately, because we were in a cold spell. It took me a full week to find the correct phone number to get information on a refund. I found out the company would only fix or replace it. I would not recommend this product due to the lousy customer service. I am only giving two stars because while it was working was quite easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra S

customer_reviews.title: Works great after you get the app connected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, just looks t how your old one is wired and then swap it out. Took about ten minutes and I had to add the "c" wire in my furnace. The Android app was a bit annoying to setup, I put in the wrong wifi password the first attempt and I had to delete the app from my phone and re install it to get it to recognize the thermostat again.
customer_reviews.author: rjm

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect and easy to install and control
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my old Radio Thermostat which didn't look or work as good. Changed wifi routers and it was a nightmare to try to get old one to reconnect. This Thermostat looks great, and was very easy to install using the step by step instructions, pictures, and wire labels provided and in the apps setup. Only 5 wires, and the app tells you exactly what to do. Turned it on and WALA, it works perfectly! A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: FTCSSSW

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, loved that each step was outlined in the phone app with corresponding videos. Quick and easy to program. With the rebate from our local power company it was a no brainer upgrading to this thermostat. There are two minor things I would like to see added though. 1) my wife misses the "Hold" feature from our old thermostat. You could make it stay at the same temp indefinitely. The Sensi only "holds" until the next scheduled temp change 2) Would be nice if you could pull up your daily run time in the app instead of the monthly report that is sent via email. These are only minor issues - great product!
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Remote access
customer_reviews.text: Simple to instal if you have 3 wires and easy to connect to app. I have 4 of them for a year round log cabin in a cold climate. I like to be able to see room temp, outside temp and the days high and low temp outside. Then I can ajust my thermostat on my phone or ipad from anywhere. Also when the power goes out and comes back online it reconnects. You need wifi but if it goes out it works like a standard thermostat. Its peace of mind for a property i may not be at for weeks in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: David Dunfee

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi deal on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT! The best wifi thermostats I've ever purchased. Super easy installation and totally user friendly. Customer service is awesome. I needed an adapter to connect one of mine to an older AC. The customer service/tech walked me thorough a number of potential workarounds after hours. Very impressive. The type of service that builds solid brand loyalty. I highly recommend this product and this company.
customer_reviews.author: MarlinChaser

customer_reviews.title: New Thermostate
customer_reviews.text: I did some research and found that this brand was easy to connect to home systems and phone, The setup was hard. From watching the videos on the site and form various other YouTube, thought that this was able to be done without hiring a electrician. Since I own an older home and system the cable coding on the app was not much help and had to get a electrician to come out. The sight had two vendors to call for homes, when I called the first they only did business, called the second one and he set up an appointment, Helped get to install and setup and get functioning on my phone. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wi-fi thermostat, a bit confusing to install
customer_reviews.text: Once installed, very nice thermostat. Minimalist design and easy to use. Has worked well for the past month. The installation took a couple of tries however, as the online is not clear that one needs to distinguish between a conventional and heat pump system early on, because the labeling of the wires is different in your existing thermostat, depending on what type of system you have (one is on the right side, the other on the left). Ensure you determine what type of system you currently have before beginning, and follow the correct wire labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two for my new home to replace the super old dial Honeywell thermostat. I did have to get up to the attic to wire the C-wire on the air handlers for both. That was a bit of extra work, but the thermostats have been working very well for both cooling in the summer time and heating. I also took an advantage of getting a rebate from my energy provider.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and Wi-Fi feature is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for upstairs and one for downstairs. They were relatively easy to install and they work well with the app on my phone. You can program temperature changes throughout the day and set different schedules each day of the week. If you are away and want to change the temperature setting you can do it from your phone. I love that convenience. I travel a lot and needed this flexibility to change settings while I am away. The temp display on the thermostat is really big so it’s easy to see even from far away. I’m really pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thermostat, Once you get it setup....
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Sensi so far. I did a lot of research and it seemed to be the best option with the best reviews and price. Setup could have been better. My old thermostat had the wires labeled two different ways, so it was a challenge figuring out where to plug them in for the Sensi. After finally figuring it out, I had a hard time getting the Sensi to pair with the app. It took about 5-6 tries before it finally synced up. Since then it has worked perfectly. I really like that you can adjust the cycle time so it's not turning the unit on and off constantly.
customer_reviews.author: plantman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed (again)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second "smart" thermostat in about a two week period. First I got a Honeywell which would not switch between hot and cold by itself and now the Sensi. This technology is clearly not ready to be out in the world. The Sensi was far better when it came to installation. However, the app does not communicate with the thermostat. If you need to set a schedule you MUST do so in the thermostat itself. After that it's a gamble you risk in assuming the thermostat will stick to that schedule. For the money that is being asked for these devices there should be a more reliable quality standard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wells

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! Thermostat is super sensitive causing unit to cycle rapidly. This creates stress on the AC unit and increased our electric bill over $100 per month. Electric bill went from $245 to $365. Thermostat blew a fuse in our AHU. Inconvenienced w no AC, then costs $130 for tech to locate issue then replace fuse. Spent 45 min w tech support answering the same questions over-and-over-and-over. I originally wanted replacement which was denied. Then requested a refund. This also was denied. Terrible product and terrible customer service. Buy another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Works greats!
customer_reviews.text: The Sensi thermostat works great make sure you have a "c" wire. Mine had one tucked back in the wall. If your not sure open your unit. I did have an issue getting the unit to connect to the app. After about 10 tries I reboot my phone then it connected. If you get the error unable to create a secure connection during setup. Reboot your phone and try again. I thought it was an issue with the unit. Once connected to the sensi app; it is real easy to connect alexa. You must setup the Sensi app before you can connect in alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Product is great but customer service is awful.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, but the service is awful. When I was setting up the thermostat, I encountered problems getting it to pick up my wi-fi. I sent an email to customer support for help. After a few hours the system finally recognized my Wi-Fi. It took the company 21 days to respond to my plea for help. I find this unacceptablle. I love the product. However, I later discovered that I could have gotten. $75 rebate if I had purchased it through my local utility. I'm sure customer service would have been 1000% times better, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Vonnegut Fan

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for (1) programmed temperature control and (2) geofencing (adjusting temperature when you leave home). I was VERY disappointed to find out that you can have one or the other but not both. It's just tepid product design to separate these features; there's no reason why they couldn't be combined. And no where does their product description make it clear that they are not available together.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Guy

customer_reviews.title: great thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: works very well! Alexa integration isn't as easy as I hoped. (when you set a temp, what mode the stat is in is important to know and some commands seems to confuse Alexa, not sure if this an Alexa voice recognition thing or Sensi) phone app is great! easy to set schedules! and you can program multi schedules and switch between them. (Vacation, normal, in-laws in town, etc) more then 1/2 the price of other smart stat! and it qualifies with our energy provider for a $75 energy star rebate. (So I paid $40 for this - what?!?!?!)
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Emerson Sensi Touch Wi-Fi Smart Thermostat with Touchscreen Color Display, Works with Alexa, Energy Star Certified, C-wire Required, ST75
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Pattern Name:ThermostatThe Sensi Touch Wi-Fi smart thermostat puts comfort control at your fingertips whether you are at home or on-the-go. Just a tap of the easy-to-use touchscreen display or free mobile app lets you remotely access, change or program your home temperatures – anytime. Anywhere. Designed to work with HVAC equipment in most homes*** (U.S. & Canada only), Sensi mobile app guides you through each step of the DIY installation process. Most people install Sensi in 30 minutes or less**. A common wire (c-wire) is required for all system types. Refer to our online compatibility resources at sensi.emerson.com/compatibility to make sure Sensi thermostat will work in your home. Once your Sensi thermostat is up and running, you can let your location automatically adjust your temperature settings with geofencing or use the intuitive controls to create a custom schedule, to save about 23% on your HVAC energy usage*. Plus, your Sensi thermostat integrates directly with Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Assistant and Wink home automation platforms to give you a complete smart home experience. Set, lower or raise your home temperature with simple voice commands using Alexa or control your Sensi thermostat using Siri on your iPhone or iPad. Connect to comfort in color with thoughtful design features like intuitive menus, easy-to-read temperatures, back glow, precision temperature control, smart alerts and more. What’s more, Sensi Touch Wi-Fi thermostat has been named the ‘best overall’ smart thermostat of 2017, 2018 and 2019 by USA Today’s Reviewed.com. *Energy savings calculated by comparing operation time for a nationwide sample of Sensi users with temperature adjustments averaging 4 degreeF vs. users with no adjustments.
